inn1.comm: in the zone outside off stump, cutting in from short of length, left alone
short in length again, goes for the cut but doesn't connect
length delivery shaping in towards the off stump, defended on the front foot
short in length and outside off, McCullum thinks about the cut but lets it go
drifts towards the pads, clipped to deep square-leg and Malinga gets across to cut it off
length delivery on the off stump line, defended on the front foot
back of length, cutting away, Ryder taps it towards third man
short in length around the off stump, McCullum gets forward to push it back down the pitch
pushes it wide outside off, McCullum went for the cut but couldn't reach it. And free hit coming up ..
full in length and outside off stump, Baz has a big swing at it, across the line, and edges it over the slip cordon
length delivery around off and middle, McCullum leans forward to defend down the pitch
risky single. it was pushed towards mid-off and they set for the run; Malinga rushes forward and flings in a throw but misses the stumps
back of length delivery around the off stump, pushed to cover
good delivery, probing around the off stump, cuts back in and McCullum lets it go by .. it wasn't all that far from the off stump
gets behind the line of the in cutter to defend to the off side
slightly slower one, full in length and in the corridor outside off, left alone
tight line and length continues; homing in on the off stump, defended on the front foot
this one curves away from the off stump line, McCullum decides to leave it but is late in doing so and the ball runs off the face of the bat to third man
angling away from McCullum who allows it to pass through to the keeper
straighter, worked to midwicket region for a single
around the off stump line, back of length ,steered to third man for a single
135.5 kmph length delivery that lands just outside off and shapes in, McCullum leaves it and it bounces into Sanga's gloves
wide outside off, Baz, standing outside the crease, tries to slap it over point but doesn't connect
length delivery around the off stump, stabbed off the inner edge and the ball rolls between his legs and towards square-leg for a single
And this one is a wide down the leg side. Sanga dives to collect it
outside off stump, left alone
on the pads, tries to clip it away, misses and is struck on the pad
Shot. Short in length and outside off, Baz goes back to force it on the up and through covers. Very well done.
full in length around the off stump, leans forward to defend
cuts in towards the off stump, pushed towards mid-on for a quick single
Whack. Slightly wide outside off and Ryder thrashes it through extra cover. New Zealand get a move on here.
full in length, moving towards off and middle, deflected wide of midwicket for a single
in the channel outside off, shaping away, left alone
whack! fullish outside off stump, Ryder crashes it through cover point but almost collapses immediately .. he is in pain
on the middle and leg, turned to left of square-leg where Kandamby makes a half-stop.
on the off stump line, dabbed to the on side
on back of length, on the stumps, worked behind square-leg for a single

Ryder is in pain and has decided not to hang around and waste his time there. He is going to go for everything. It was short outside off, he top edged the upper cut towards third man where it falls short of Mendis and spins away from him. He makes a complete mess of it.
on the leg stump line, shoveled over square-leg
pushes it wide outside off stump, Ryder can't reach
gets behind the line to push it to mid-on
Bosh. He reached across to meet a full length delivery well outside off and lift it over extra cover. Up she flew ...
short in length on the middle and leg, clipped through midwicket and mendis ran after it and almost kicks it further away from him!
Top shot boss! It was slightly short in length and outside off, Ryder pulled it high over midwicket boundary. He is on a roll here.
goes for a hard off drive this time but can't beat mid-off
short in length outside off, goes hard again but mistimes it towards mid-off
Top quality shot. It was short of length and outside off, he knifed on the up through the line and eases it through cover point
slower one outside off, tries to run it down to third man, misses
He is rocking on. Short in length and outside off stump, not much foot movement but he held his balance well, opened the bat-face and timed it superbly past point
closer to the body, pushed away to the off side

dropped by Kandamby. It jumped from back of length, on the body, Ryder shoveled it in the air towards right of square-leg where Kandamby didn't judge well intially, moving back instead of forward, lunged out in the end and seemed to have got it but the ball slipped out.. He is angry with himself and flings the ball on the ground
beaten by the carrom ball. It cut away, slightly, outside off and McCullum poked at it
goes for the sweep and connects well. Malinga gets across to his left but makes a mess of it
straighter, fuller on the middle, defended back down the pitch
on the middle and off, pushed out towards cover
on the middle, worked to midwicket
straight, full, on the middle, gets the bat in front of the pad to defend
bangs it in short, goes for the pull and top edges it over Sanga
reaches out to a fuller ball and drags it back near leg stump
change of pace, searches for the yorker, a bit too full and McCullum turns the ball to midwicket and sets off even as Jayasuriya runs in to collect, thats good running
thumped! Ryder gets up one leg and swats a short ball through square leg for four, well struck that shot

tries the shot again to a ball that is fuller and though it is not timed well at all he gets four, just went through with the shot with much power and dragged the ball down between midwicket and mid-on
better ball, pitched up on a length and Ryder just stands back and knocks the ball to mid-on to raise a very good half-century, well played Ryder
googly on leg stump, pushed down toward mid-on
quicker ball, cuts back in off a shorter length and McCullum punches the ball into the off side
wider ball spins away and that allows Ryder free his arms and drive into the gap at cover, McCullum and Tuffey run hard and get two as the sweeper is slow too
flighted up around the off stump, tapped to point for one
stays low outside off stump, no turn, too short and McCullum cuts a single square on the off side to keep the score ticking
ah, beaten! Ryder pushes at one outside off stump that doesn't turn
gets forward to defend the ball back down the track
gets forward to push it to covers for a single
fiery yorker, Ryder just about manages to dig it out and he topples over and falls to the ground
around the off stump, steered to backward point
slower one, fullish outside off, run down to third man
sharp bouncer on the middle stump line, McCullum ducks, gets up and walks down the track, chewing his gum
leans forward to drive to long-off
leans forward to defend to the off side
goes for his sweep shot and gets Ryder back on strike
googly and Ryder goes for the big swing across the line and misses
moves outside leg stump , Mendis follows him and Ryder pushes it wide of midwicket for a single
googly on the off and middle line, stabbed off the inner edge past square-leg
length delivery straightening on the middle line, squeezed through cover point
yorker length, perhaps just short of the blockhole, pushed out to point. No foot movement, he stays adjacent to the line, head steady and hence, good balance...
length delivery jumping up outside off, Ryder is beaten and Sanga doesn't collect it cleanly and the ball just about misses the helmet behind the keeper!
yorker length on the off and middle, pushed out past the non-striker for a single
lovely delivery buzzing outside off stump, Ryder, his feet glued to where it was, tries to run it down to third man and is beaten
back of length, skidding on to the middle, worked to midwicket
on the middle stump line, turned to midwicket
off spinner, leans forward to defend to the off side
carrom ball on the off stump line, pushed out to the off side
this one breaks back in, worked to the on side
skids on quicky towards off and middle, tapped to the off side
googly , turning in from the off stump line, McCullum goes right back to carefully nudge it to the on side
on the off stump line, steered through cover point to the sweeper cover
slower one, full around the off stump, driven to left of mid-off for a quick single
back of length delivery outside off stump, Ryder pulls it high over the bowler's head  .. he flat-batted it up and over
bangs it in short, steered to left of backward point where Dilshan makes a fine diving stop
good bouncer at the body, McCullum is cramped as he goes for the pull and gets a fat edge to fine-leg boundary. 100 up for New Zealand. What a start. They were put into bat here.
full i nlength on the off stump line, mistimed to the left of Kulasekara at mid-off
short and wide, enough for McCullum to jump into action with a feisty cut shot
short in length, outside off stump, goes for the cut but misses
length delivery outside off stump, McCullum goes for the drive and is beaten
short in length, bounces in towards off stump, defended to the off side
cuts in a bit from outside off, punched to cover
on the middle stump line, moving towards middle and off, driven to left of extra cover where Samaraweera makes a half-stop
fullish on the leg stump line, pushed out through to long-on and I think ryder hit his bat on to his ankle and he is in pain again. He limps away to square-leg
leans forward to squeeze the full length delivery through cover point
Ryder moves outside leg, Kula slips in a slower one around off, slapped away to sweeper cover
full in length outside off, driven to deep cover for a single
low dipping full toss .. driven down to sweeper cover
on the pads, tries to swat it away but misses.
walks down the track, the bowler shortens the length and McCullum flashes an upper cut down to wide third man
just outside off, cut to Dilshan at backward point
slower one, on the middle stump line, pushed towards mid-on for a single
length delivery skidding towards middle and off line, defended on the front foot
Ryder on the storm. He leans forward to thrash a full length delivery in the air and to the right of long-on fielder
fullish, around off stump, driven to Mendis at long-off
slower one, Ryder moves outside leg and adjusts to the lack of pace by stabbing it to the on side
more violence from Ryder. Low full toss on the stumps, Ryder swings it to wide long-on boundary. Crash.
length delivery around off stump, driven to deep cover
on a length just outside off, punched to sweeper cover
Ryder falls after a fab knock. He goes for a big swing across the line but edges it to Sangakkara. What a fine start he has given NZ, though.
skids on to the middle, worked to the on side
on the middle stump line, pushed towards non striker
on the middle, pushed back to the bowler
leans well forward to defend
on the middle stump line, defended to the bowler
on the middle and leg line, eased to long-on
leans forward to flick it to deep backward square-leg
on a length, around the middle and leg, pushed out to the on side
leans forward to drive it down to long-on
on the middle, nibbling back in a bit, worked to midwicket

Baz too is gone. Two quick wickets as Sri Lanka try to claw their way back into the game. McCullum tried to turn a length delivery to the on side but gets a leading edge towards backward point where Dilshan lunges forward to grab it
short and well outside off stump, he goes back and across to flay it to point boundary
short in length outside off, cut down to backward point
full and around the off stump, driven to Dilshan at short extra cover
And again. Dilshan lunges to his right to stop it
slows up the pace, eases down to long-off

Boy o Boy, Sri Lanka are roaring back into the game. Triple strike. It was floated outside off stump, he leans forward to push hard at it and it balloons off the outer edge off the shoulder of the bat to backward point. Gone! Wobble time for NZ.
slip in place and Eliott defends it to the on side
back of length outside off, squeezed down to third man
Lovely on drive. He fetched the full delivery from the middle and whipped it through wide mid-on region. There was a danger of missing it and being caught in a lbw situation but he pulled it off
leans forward to push it to long-on
shuffles across to the off side and dabs it to backward point

Dead plumb in front. Nailed him in front of middle. It was fullish delivery sliding towards middle, Elliot was on the shuffle, trying to work it across the line, misses it and has to return to the hutch. What a collapse.
full in length and outside off, left alone
on the middle and off line, defended to the off side
leans forward to push it towards extra cover for a single
slows up the pace, around the off stump, defended on the front foot
leans forward to drive to cover
skids on in from outside off stump, defended to the off side
keeps a tad low, goes for the cut but can't connect
length delivery outside off stump, guided to backward point
leans forward to wrist it through midwicket
on the middle, going for another lbw, the batsman takes care to get the front foot out of the way, brings the bat in front to push it wide of mid-on
fullish on the off stump line, driven to Jayasuriya at long-on
full delivery around off stump, eased to mid-off
lovely slower one, teasing line outside off and the batsman pushes inside the line and is beaten
leans forward to defend it back to Sanath
outside off stump, pushed out to covers. One slip in place.
skids on towards off stump, jabbed back down the pitch
just outside off stump, punched to sweeper cover
around the off stump, driven to deep cover again
outside off stump, fuller, steered to backward point
full pitched delivery around the off and middle, Broom strides forward to caress it past the non-striker and it rushes away
short in length on the middle and off line, tries to dab it across the line and edges it down to third man
slower one outside off, dabbed to backward point
short in length, homing in on the off stump, pushed to the bowler
slower off cutter, nudged towards backward point
full in length outside off stump, eased to cover
flighted outside off stump, goes for the square drive and edges it past backward point
glides forward to ease this one through midwicket
quicker, outside off, nudged wide of backward point
leans forward to defend to the on side
on the middle and leg, pushed towards non striker
around the off stump, steered through cover point
he bowls leg breaks. Drops this one short, pushed away to dilshan at short extra cover
leans forward to defend the flighted delivery to the off side
shorter in length, turns away, cut to point
lands on a length on the middle and leg, turns, defended on the front foot
turns outside off stump, goes for the cut and misses it
flighted full on the middle and leg, flicked away
short in length, skidding outside off, beaten on the cut
What a tame dismissal. They seem to be out doing each other. Short and wide, cut weakly, a dolly of a catch, to backward point. Sanath can't believe it himself
on the middle stump line, dabbed past square-leg
leans forward to push it through covers
goes right back to flick it away for a single
fullish on the legs, flicked away for couple of runs
outside off stump, tries to steer it down and gets a bottom edge
short of length outside off stump, flashed away to third man
back of length outside off, bouncing through to Sanga, left alone
short in length, kicks up outside off stump, cut down past backward point for a single
in the corridor outside off stump, Vettori tries to run it down to third man and is beaten

Sanga fails to run out Vettori Short in length, punched out to cover point and they try to take on Mahela who flings in a throw to Sangakkara. here is where the problem starts. It appears that Sanga didn't collect it cleanly and when he broke the stumps, the ball had popped out of the gloves. What a miss. Vettori was well short of the crease (It was referred to the third umpire)
leans forward to push the ball to the on side
outside off stump, tapped to right of short third man
on the middle stump line, driven wide of mid-on
on the middle and off line, cut down to right of short third man
full pitched well outside off, eased to the left of sweeper cover
short in length, on the middle and off line, tapped close to the off side for a quick single
leans forward to push it towards midwicket and they take on the fielder .. risky run but they get across .. the throw misses the stumps
Wow! A stunner! It was the bouncer outside off, Vettori calmly arches back to upper cut/steer it over third man! It was not flashed away violently; he just sort of steered it up and over.
almost caught at lone slip: Vettori edged an intended steer against a short-of-length delivery and it went high over Mahela who leaped but couldn't quite reach it. It brushed his fingers
gets forward to push it to the off side for a single
leans forward to nurdle it around the corner for a single. Ah! no.. Binoy shouts at me .. it was a leg bye
on the off stump line,. punched to left of mid-off for a single
on the middle and leg, turned past square-leg
gets forward to push it to the off side .. Dilshan dives from extra cover, doesn't cut it and it goes to mid-off...
moves forward to drive to long-on
on the middle and leg, cutting in, clipped past square-leg
short in length, around the off stump line, worked to midwicket for a easy single
full in length, slanting across outside off, left alone
kicks up from short of length, angles across, he tries to steer it and is beaten. He looks pretty surprised at the extra bounce there
just outside off stump, punched down to sweeper cover
fullish, down the leg side, tries to glance, doesn't connect properly and Sangakkara dives to make the stop
shuffles across to clip a short-of-length delivery to the on side
drifts down the leg side, Dan stays back to play a neat leg glance
around the off stump, defended to cover
on the middle, turned to the on side where Dilshan makes a diving stop
long hop and Dan pulls it to deep square-leg where the fielder dives to his right but doesn't stop it .. He should have
gets on the front foot to deflect it to Dilshan at midwicket
works it wide of Dilshan for a single
walks towards the off stump and guides the full delivery down to third man
outside off stump, going across the batsman who tries to dab it to third man and is beaten
short in length, chopped to the off side
punched to left of cover where Dilshan rushes across to make a lunging stop
makes sure he gets this one wide of Dilshan and collects a single
really full outside off stump, almost yorker length, dug out to left of point where Dilshan gets into the act again with another diving effort
length delivery angling away, goes for the big on-the-up drive but misses it
lands on a length on the middle, skids on straight, punched to the on side
drops it shorter, pulled away for a single
on the off stump line, defended to the off side
on the off stump line, punched to Malinga at long-off
flighted full around the off stump line, driven to long-off
just outside off stump line, forced to sweeper cover
on the off stump line, squeezes his off drive through covers
what happened there? The action went completely awry at the release and the  ball was sprayed really wide outside off
almost dragged on. It was not all that far from the off stump, Vettori tries to late cut it and the ball goes off the edge and past the off stump and to the fine-leg boundary
walks right across to clip it from outside off through midwicket
goes outside off again, Thushara hurls it wider outside off .. Vettori tries to run it to third man but misses it
gets outside off stump and works it from there past square-leg
short in length and in the zone outside off stump, goes for the cut but doesn't connect
off break outside off stump, square driven in the air to deep point
googly from the off stump line, eased to long-off
another googly, goes past the waft and hits him on the pad in front of the stumps but pitched just outside leg stump
floated outside off stump, Vettori goes for the sweep but no wood on leather
really full in length, almost yorker length, Vettori misses to connect and Sanga doesn't collect it cleanly
drops it short and pulled to deep midwicket
drops it short of length, skids on towards middle, clipped away to the on side
stays back to work the back-of-length delivery from middle to deep midwicket region
floated full on the middle, shoveled uppishly past midwicket

Sort of tame dismissal again. It was floated full outside off, Vettori chips it straightly to long-on. He didn't hit it hard, neither did he go along the ground but he just chipped it straight to the fielder
pushes it off the back foot for an easy single
gets down to the front foot and pushes this one for a single to long-off
an offbreak, taken from just outside and clipped down the ground, in the air but wide of Mendis
flighted googly, Guptill makes room and tries to cut but can't beat backward point
another offbreak, flighted well and hit down the ground for one
superb running, hits this one to wide of long-off, and Guptill calls early and makes it to the danger end
early into the shot, but this one goes wide enough of Mendis to get him a single
offbreak, Guptill makes room, but finds Mendis has followed him, but gets one down to long-on
back of a length, across him, and forced through the off side
full ball, takes the outside half of the bat and hence goes to mid-off softly enough for them to come through for one
length ball, outside off, hit down to long-off for an easy single
beats him square, 137ks, just back of a length, and kicks off, holding its line outside off. Franklin ends up playing inside the line
length ball, and pushed towards midwicket for one
right out of the screws, length ball, in his zone, he clears his arms, and lofts it over long-on, sweetly times
full ball, on the pads, and played to long-on for one
tries the carrom ball, not much break on this, hit forcefully but can't beat extra cover
superbly timed again, straight hit, quickly through Mendis's legs, a dive from Malinga saves the boundary
slower and a touch shorter, played to long on for one
offbreak, on the pads, worked away for one
googly tried, not much turn again, gets on to front foot and drives it down to long-on for one
sprays it full and well outside off, wide
Guptill is flowing freely here. IT was a full delivery outside off, he sliced it beautifully high over mid-off .. one bounce and over long-off boundary
full pitched on the off and middle line, drags the intended heave to deep square-leg
lovely yorker, just outside off, squeezes past the bat and past the off stump
around the off stump, pretty full again, pushed out towards mid-off for a quick single
how does he keep bowling these yorkers, ball after ball... And how did this one miss the off stump? It was slung across at rapid pace, whooshed past the waft and almost kissed the off stump
full again, driven down the track, Malinga gets his boot in the way and deflects it behind him
Slashed away. He moved outside leg stump and slapped a short-of-length delivery to deep backward point boundary
leans forward to drive it through the on side
low full toss, dipping on the middle and leg line, whipped through midwicket
glides forward to drive to kula at long-on
flicks it on a length, on the middle and leg, driven through the on side
moves outside leg, Mendis follows him with a full delivery, driven to long-on. Free hit coming up
smashed away. low dipping full toss, clears the front foot and crashes it to wide long-on boundary
full delivery on the middle, driven really hard to left of long-on where Mahela makes a fine diving stop
run out chance missed. It was another yorker, dug out towards covers and rushes across. Angelo misses the stumps the non-striker's end
full again, just outside off, squeezed off the outer edge to third man
yet another yorker on the middle, oh boy what a guy, Guptill edges it to his pad
pretty full again, this time outside off, steered to backward point where Dilshan makes a rare fumble
Clatter! The stumps are in disarray. Yep, it was the yorker. Nice, fast, straight and at the base of the off and middle stump line. Fine innings from Guptill ends.
just short of the blockhole, outside off, pushed out to cover
from round the stumps, full one again, pushed out towards long-off
Oh my .. he has smoked that .. It was full delivery again, Franklin thrashes it straight down the pitch, back past the bowler, the umpire and to the straight boundary
And so, Kula returns with a yorker outside off, tries to dig it out and misses
low dipping full toss, mistimes the drive to extra cover
he has hammered that! From round the stumps comes a overpitched delivery around off, Mills swings it hard and over long-off
full toss outside off. Blink. It has crashed against the long-off boundary. he swung it powerfully
sprays it well outside off stump and Sanga doesn't collect cleanly  .. NZ are on 303 .
goes for the yorker, ends up as a dipping full toss, driven past Malinga and by the time long-on comes across they collect two runs
Mills moves outside leg, Malinga follows him with full delivery and Mills squeezes it off the inner edge past the short fine-leg fielder. Four more! 309 now
And now the outside edge! Full delivery, swing of the bat, thick edge and the ball flies through the vacant slip region!
Ouch. The yorker follows Mills who backs away to the leg side and he is hit on the back foot.
another yorker on the off stump line, dug out through mid-on for a single.

inn2.comm: on a length around the off stump, defended to the off side
short in length delivery on the off and middle line , tries to slash it  away and is beaten
gets behind the line of the length delivery this time and defends it towards mid-off
he had missed the attempted slash second ball but connects this time. It was shorter this time and he flashed it over backward point in style
here we go. He is going after em already. A short delivery outside off and moving away in fact but Dilshan fetches it from there and pulls it superbly over midwicket boundary
Welcome to the attack bondy. It was full in length and on the leg and middle line, Jayasuriya flicks it on the up over square-leg. Wafted it away in style
clips the length delivery from the middle stump to backward square-leg for a single
Disdain. It was back of length delivery just outside off stump, Dilshan stands up tall to force it past Bond.
Lucky this time. Short of length holding its line outside off, Dilshan tries to force it through the off side and gets a thick edge to fine-leg boundary
Slap! Another short-of-length delivery and Dilshan just loves em outside off. Doesn't he? He has flayed that one to the point boundary.
back of length on the middle, turned past square-leg
cuts in towards the hips, tries to leg glance it, misses but they scamper across for a leg bye
hops back to get on top of the bounce of a short-of-length delivery on the off stump line and defends to the off side

loud shout for lbw but turned down. It was missing off stump. It skidded on from back of length, Jayasuriya was caught on the back foot and is hit around the off stump. It was cutting away from the sticks.
just outside off stump, short in length, cut down to third man

full length delivery on the middle, Dilshan goes for the swing across the line but drags it down to fine-leg.  Had he missed it, he would have been dead plumb. But those kind of negative thoughts don't enter Dilshan's mind, do they
back of length around the off stump, steered to backward point
slightly slower one on the off stump line, pushed to short extra cover
ah! he leans across to go for the paddle scoop, misses and is struck on the pad outside the off stump. Perhaps, there was an inside-edge there
short in length, bouncing on the middle and off, Jayasuriya goes for the pull, misses and is struck high on the pad
There goes Jayasurya dancing down the track. He moved down the track, then outside leg and flat-bats a short of length delivery through extra cover
rushes down the track again, Bond fires in a yorker, dug out to the on side
length delivery around the off stump, defended to covers
short in length on the middle and leg, drags the pull past square-leg
Wham. The white ball is getting some hammering today. Not all that short but Dilshan pulls it from the off and middle to deep square-leg boundary.
Whaddaplayaaaaa! Short in length and outside off stump, Dilshan gets forward and forces it on the up and through cover point.
back of length and just outside off stump, Dilshan tries to paddle-scoop it over the keeper's head and is struck on the left shoulder
outside off stump, tries to flash it and the keeper collects
short in length and outside off stump, dabbed down to third man
bouncing delivery outside off, Dilshan tries to deposit it over backward point but fails to connect.
slower one, full, drags it past mid-on
short in length lands outside leg stump, moves in, bunted past square-leg

Oh boy .., he keeps unfurling one aggressive shot after another. You got to like watching him. He stood up tall to knife through the line of a short-of-length delivery outside off. The ball thuds into the extra cover boundary
leans forward to defend to off side
If Dilshan doesn't get you, Jayasuriya will. He walks down the track and crashes a back-of-length delivery outside off over covers
just outside off stump, run down to third man
short in length, moves in towards middle and leg, Dilshan is cramped up, jabs it to the on side
length delivery, full in length mind you but Dilshan stays adjacent to the line and cuts it to backward point
Vroom! I don't know what Vroom means but I hope it suggests some excitement! Cos that;'s what Dilshan is doing here. He walks down the track and heaves the delivery over mid-off
length delivery outside off stump, tries to crash it through the off-side field but can't beat the field
on the middle and leg, squeezed past square-leg for couple of runs
They are going berserk here. Jayasuriya walks down the track and has a big swing across the line and top edges it over slip cordon
length delivery around the off stump line, defended to cover
Another huge swing but no wood on leather. Jayasuriya wanted to send it back to Matara ... big swoosh off the bat across the line but fails to connect
And he has combusted now. Couldn't escape the adrenalin rush. He moved down the track and tried to pull a shorter delivery over midwicket but top-edged it straight up to midwicket.
full delivery outside off stump, drives hard but can't pierce the off-side field
back of length around off stump, pushed towards mid-off
short in length around off and middle, wristed down to short midwicket

dropped by Vettori Would you believe it? It went straight in and came straight out. What a clanger. Sanga had mishit the short-of-length delivery straight to mid-off where Vettori drops a sitter. Oh dear
clips the short of length delivery to backward square-leg

Dilshan falls after an electrifying cameo. It was the short  lifting delivery that climbs on him and he mistimed the hook straight to deep square-leg. The other day he said, his wife keeps telling him don't hook don't hook and that he says yes but goes to do exactly that! And he has fallen to that shot now. Having said that, that's the shot that fetches him lots and lots of runs. No use shelving that. But but .. you should listen to your wife now and then I say!
leans forward to drive through mid-off
leans forward to defend a length delivery to the off side
just outside off stump, nudged towards backward point
shapes to defend and the ball jags back in to hit the pad high
slightly slower outside off, left alone
leans forward to push the length delivery to mid-on

Dropped by McCullum Oh dear .. they first missed Sanga and now Mahela. Tuffey got this one to shape away from Mahela who pushed at it, bat away from the body, and got a thick edge. McCullum dived to his right but couldn't hold on. More drama. McCullum should have taken it. He first moved towards his left and then just lunged out to his right. he didn't take a step towards his right.
short in length and outside off, run down to third man
outside off stump, left alone
around the off stump line, tapped towards short cover
full in length outside off, curving away, Mahela goes for the square drive and edges it well clear of backward point
short of length on the stumps, clipped past square-leg
short in length outside off, left alone
leans forward to push a short-of-length delivery to mid-on
goes back to push it towards the non-striker
bangs it in short and down the leg side, Sangakkara goes for the pull but can't reach
gets forward to push the ball towards mid-off and runs with the stroke. Vettori flicks a direct hit but Sangakkara is home
short in length around the off stump line, defended on the front foot
full in length around off stump, driven to cover
Imperious! Mahela takes a step down the track and as Tuffey shortens the length, he punches it on the up and through covers
short in length, on the middle and leg, drags it down to fine-leg
short in length around off stump, dabbed to backward point. Free hit coming up
walks outside off stump and paddles it from well outside off over the short fine-leg fielder

Sanga is gone now! 85 for 3 and wobble time. Sanga walked down the track and towards the off side, Franklin shortened the length and hit the deck outside off. Sanga pushed hard at it and edged to first slip.
short in length outside off stump, punched to cover
short in length on the middle, clipped wide of midwicket
short in length outside off stump, pushed away to backward point
lands on a length outside off, shapes away, left alone
short in length, on the off and middle, tucked to backward square-leg
full in length, just outside off stump, mistimes the drive to cover
moving in towards the off and middle, full in length, flicked away for a single
walks towards the off side and flicks the full length delivery wide of mid-on for a single
fuller, outside off stump, mistimes the drive to mid-off
full in length and in the channel outside off, left alone
length delivery in the zone outside off, angling away, left alone
walks down the track and moves towards off - he is trying to work the ball into the gaps on the leg side = and Franklin angles it further away, pushed to cover
just outside off stump, guided to backward point
around the off, even slightly outside off, short in length, Mahela swat-pulls it to the deep backward square-leg boundary
leans forward to defend to the off side
short in length outside off stump, pushed to the off side
short and wide, goes for the cut shot and misses it completely
just outside off stump, steered to backward point
Bang! The bouncer arrives and Samaraweera pulls it from outside off high over midwicket
full in length just outside off, driven to mid-off
Samaraweera too shuffles - not all the way to off stump but just a bit - and wrists the full delivery through midwicket
Mahela walks across and down the track and defends a back-of-length delivery
over pitched outside off stump and Samaraweera caresses it through to the left of mid-off
length delivery on the off stump line, pushed to left of cover for a single
slower one, full and just outside off, pushed out towards sweeper cover
shuffles across , taps the length delivery from the middle stump to square-leg for a single
back of length around off stump, pushed out to the off side
shuffles across, exposes the leg and bit of middle, and clips the ball on the middle stump line to deep backward square-leg
full in length, straightening outside off stump, mahela has a lazy waft at it and is beaten
just outside off stump, back of length, punched to covers
full in length just outside off stump, defended on the front foot
banged in short outside off, cut down to wide third man
length delivery outside off stump, Samaraweera hangs on the back foot and glides it past first slip and to left of third man
full in length outside off, pushed towards mid-off
flighted on the middle and off, pushed to the on side
arm ball just outside off, skidding on from short of length, cut past backward point
classy little cut. It was just outside off, from a length, Samaraweera rocked back to late cut it to backward point boundary

Aha! Vettori gets his man on a similar shot. It was a similar delivery, Samaraweera went for that cut again but this one bounced a bit more on him and he cut it straight to backward point. Dan the man has a triumphant smile.
from round the stumps to the lefty, nudged to the on side
on the middle stump line, turned to deep midwicket
Bond fires in a high bouncer and Kandamby ducks
short in length on the middle and off stump line, defended to the off side
short in length on the middle stump line, tucked wide of midwicket for a single
banged in short outside off, Mahela upper cuts it to right of third man where Mills cleans up
It was the short of length delivery kicking outside off stump, Kandamby opens the bat face to wrist it past slip cordon
leans forward to defend it back down the pitch
short in length outside off stump, run down to third man
turns in towards middle and leg, jabbed away
leans forward to work it through midwicket
leans forward to push it back down the pitch
turns from the off stump line, steered to cover point for a single
from over the stumps now, flighted outside off, driven to the off side
skips down the track, Dan shortens the length and Kandamby pushes it out to the off side
short in length outside off stump, opens the bat-face to work it to backward point
short in length, bouncing in, clipped down to deep backward square-leg
fullish on the middle stump line, on driven to mid-on
yorker length just outside off stump, Kandamby digs it out ... And after the ball settles adjacent to him, he swoops down, picks the ball and throws it to a fielder.
short and climbing outside off, guided to third man
leans forward to defend a length delivery to the off side
just outside off stump, pushed out towards cover point for a easy single
just outside off again, dabbed to left of covers where Taylor rushes to prevent the run
slower this time, fuller on the middle stump, defended on the front foot
quicker, skidding on straight around off stump, nudged to point
flighted on the off stump line, Mahela leans forward to ease it to the on side
turns away from the off stump, patted slightly wide of backward point for a single.

lands back of length moves towards middle, Mahela shuffles across to tuck it past square-leg The throw comes to McCullum who back flicks it to the stumps. The run out appeal is referred to third umpire but the batsman had placed the bat in
short in length and bouncing outside off, Kandamby is cramped as he goes for the cut and is beaten
leans across to push the ball to cover
full in length around off stump, driven to mid-off
fullish, on the middle stump line, wristed through midwicket
short in length towards off and middle, worked to wide midwicket region
arm-ball on the middle stump line, Mahela brings the bat in front of the pad to defend
on a length just outside off stump, Mahela shapes for the cut , gets a thick edge which takes the ball well to the left of short third man

Kandamby is run out. What a mix up. it was turned towards deep midwicket, they completed the first run, turned for the second and the hesitation started here. A slight stutter, brief pause from both before they scamper across but Kandamby doesn't make it in time
lovely delivery drifting in from round the stumps, lands on a length around off and spins away past the outside edge
moves forward to push it to the on side
gets forward to push it to the on side and Vettori rushes to stop it
full in length and just outside off stump, left alone
strides forward to crash the full delivery really hard but Tuffey dives to his left to make the stop
short in length, turned to midwicket
slightly slower one, on a length around off, pushed out to mid-off
just outside off stump, dabbed to short third man region
flighted on the off stump line, driven to long-off
quicker, on the middle, deflected to midwicket
flighted around off stump line, defended on the front foot
quickish, bouncing outside off, defended to the off side
tossed on the middle, turns it through midwicket
around the off stump line, defended to the on side
Angelo crashes out of the chase. He took a step forward and went for a big lofted off drive but the bottom-hand came off the handle and he ended up punching the ball straight to short extra cover
short in length outside off stump, rushes past the outside edge
goes on the back to defend to the on side
low full toss outside off stump, edges the intended cover drive along the ground to first slip
almost a run out! It was turned towards midwicket and Franklin rushes after it, picked the ball, turned around and flung a throw at the non-striker's end but misses it
on the middle stump line, nudged to the on side
drops slightly short, mistimes the cut to covers
flighted around off stump, driven to sweeper cover
leans well forward to push it back to the bowler
lands on a length outside off, turns away, left alone
Stunning shot. What a welcome to the attack. Mahela reached forward, picked the full length delivery and deposited it over the straight boundary. Quality oozing out of that.
Dropped by Elliott Tough chance. Mahela lifted it towards sweeper cover where Elliott ran forward and dived but couldn't hold on
really full delivery, defended to the off side
pretty full in length around off stump, driven to Elliott
low full toss outside off stump, Mahela opens the bat-face and plays a lovely late cut to third man boundary
pitched up just a fraction outside off, nudged away into the leg side wide of midwicket for a single
hurled it short on middle, swivelled to pull it through square leg,  missed and was struck high on the pads
fullish on the pads, worked away through to fine leg for a single
Mahela had made up his mind, Mills bowled it straight, he made way and steered it past the diving point, Patel gives chase from cover and drags it back
back of a length on middle, punched back to the bowler from the crease
short of a good length just outside off, dropped it with soft hands in front of point and scampered through for a quick single
pitches it short again, rose up to strike him on the glove, played uppishly into the leg side for a single
short of a good length outside off, chops it down from the crease to short third

all the way! Inventive, hurls it short on middle, Jayawardene shuffles and hoicks it over the fine-leg boundary for six runs, had decided that had to go and executed it superbly, reaches his half-century in the process
there's more to come, overpitched outside off, Mahela moves towards it and drives him powerfully over the covers for four more
good reply, in the blockhole on the off stump, tries to drive it through midwicket, gets an inside edge onto his pads, scrambles a single

chance of a run-out, banged in short on leg stump, fends it away into the leg side towards the keeper, takes off, McCullum collects and hurls it at the non-striker's end but misses, would have been gone had that hit
nicely done, pitched up on the off, drilled past the bowler just wide of long-on for a couple more
high bouncer, Kulasekara goes for the pull and misses.
oh my .. he has blasted that one. Kulasekara backed away outside leg and murdered a short-of-length delivery high over cover boundary. Fab hit.
down the leg side and another extra
short of the yorker length outside off, pushed out to mid-off
shuffles to the off side and paddles it to fine-leg
full delivery, driven to the off side
Loverly shot that. He took a stride out, cleared his front foot and swung the full delivery over long-on.

appeal for a catch behind. And the umpires confer with each other. Mahela's reaction seems to suggest there was no edge on it. It was really full outside off stump and Mahela jams the bat on the ground; the bat hits the ground and as the ball goes through to the keeper. Third umpire says not out.
full again, square driven for a single
charges down the track and drives a full delivery outside off to sweeper cover
yorker arrives and mahela gets his front leg out of the way and squeezes the ball to midwicket region
another yorker, dragged towards Taylor at midwicket and they scamper across
full pitched around the off stump, driven to right of extra cover where a diving stop is made
on the off stump line, loopy delivery, defended on the front foot
quicker, skids on towards middle and off, pushed towards  long-on, Vettori rushes back, the long-on fielder rushes forward and the batsman cross over for the second run
turning away from the off stump, defended to point
quicker just outside off, dabbed to short third man
leans forward to on drive towards long-on
full in length on the middle, turned to wide midwicket
Classy strike. What a knock this from the former Sri Lanka captain. It was a full delivery on the off stump line, mahela stays adjacent to cream it to left of mid-off
length delivery just outside off, pushed to point for a single
good probing delivery bursting off back of length outside off and holding its line, Kulasekara pushed inside the line and is beaten
gets behind the line to defend to the off side
lifting delivery outside off stump, Kulasekara upper cuts it towards third man where Mills makes a frantic effort to try to get to it .. he couldn't reach it
bounces from short of length, Kulasekara allows it to pass through to McCullum
leans forward to tuck into the gap in midwicket for a single
leans forward to work it through the on side for a single
And Mahela rotates the strike with a drive towards long-on
flighted around off, driven along the ground past the lunging Vettori to long-off
quicker, on the middle and off line, pushed down to long-on
around the off stump, pushed out to covers
leans forward to tuck it to the on side for yet another single
short in length, on the middle stump line, stands on his toes to push it to the on side
short in length, buzzing outside off stump, Kulasekara goes for a cut and a miss. Mahela takes couple of steps down the track and says something
short in length, coming in to the middle stump line, defended to midwicket
high bouncer and it climbs well over Kulasekara; wide it is
slower one ,. fullish, pushed towards extra cover
cutting in with bounce, on the middle stump line, evades the defensive poke and runs off the body. Good tight over this.
flighted on the middle and leg line, slow through the air, turns slightly,  Mahela pushes it in the air but drops well short of the bowler

Dan the man strikes with a big wicket!  He pushed this one through quicker, Mahela was looking to lift it over the off-side field but missed it completely. Clatter! The off stump is pegged back. it landed on a length on the off and middle line and crashed into the off stump.  Excellent knock but he has to go now. New Zealand move ahead in this fascinating game.
leans well forward to defend to the on side
gets forward to defend to the off side
quickish delivery on the leg and middle line, pushes at it , rolls away off the gloves to short third man
leans forward to defend to the off side
moves forward to dab it to the on side
full in length, just outside off stump, edges the drive to his pad ...
short in length and outside off stump, pushed down to third man for a single. 95 to win from 63 balls. Tough ask now

from round the stumps, fullish, driven to Tuffey at long-off. What a game this has been. We have had some good thrilling games in this tourney. Can this one go down to the wire. New Zealand well ahead at this stage.
full in length, just outside off stump, guided to point
full in length, coming in from that round-the-stumps angle, eased to long-off and he will retain the strike
gets forward to whip it through midwicket
leans forward to drive to sweeper cover
What a shot! He has some genuine talent with the bat .. He just backed away and lifted the ball with the turn over extra cover. It kept flying
pushes it to the off side for a single

77 from 55 now! Thushara clears the front foot and thrashes the flighted delivery over long-on. Vettori is trying to buy a vital wicket here so that he can terminate the chase but the Sri Lankans keep fighting on
slower, on the middle and leg, defended to the on side
moves outside leg stump and squares drive it hard slightly wide of backward point where Elliott makes a half-stop
length delivery moving in from round the stumps, Kulasekara defends it to the off side
leans forward to drive to long-off for yet another single
banged in short outside off, Thushara sways away from the line
another lifting delivery outside off, Thushara hops as he tries to upper cut it but can't put bat to ball
full in length on the middle and leg, turned to the on side for a run .
And then they were two. It was the short-of-length delivery angling across from Thushara who top-edged the pull to square-leg
climbs outside off stump, Kulasekara hops to push it down to the off side
fuller and Kulasekara has a big flash and a miss.
leans forward to drive to Taylor at long-on
back of length delivery holding its line outside off stump, Malinga can't get bat on ball.
fuller and Malinga square drives it past  diving backward point
full in length, angling in, pushed slightly wide of midwicket for a single
bouncing delivery outside off, from round the stumps, Malinga flashes it to the third-man boundary
really full delivery on the off and middle line, driven to extra cover
full again, driven uppishly but well clear of Vettoir at extra cover and it runs down to long-off
on the off stump line, driven to left of Vettori who makes a sliding stop
slower one, on the middle stump line, nurdled to backward square-leg
drifts towards the pads, rolls away to the on side
moves outside leg stump, has a big swing across the line and the ball rushes between him and the leg stump
dropped by Mills. Kulasekara topedged the all mighty swing and Mills ran back but never looked in control as he waited for gravity to pull the ball back down. Clanger!
What a stunning strike from Malingaaaaaaa! He fetched it from outside off and swung the full length delivery way over wide long-on boundary
fuller, outside off, swing and a miss
Just one more wicket now for NZ to wrap things up. Malinga swings a full toss straight to long-on. Gone! 54 from 30 but looks a distant dream now
full in length outside off stump, pushed through cover point
full delivery, driven down to long-off
bounces on the middle stump line, Mendy keeps it down, in front of him
leans across to push the ball to covers
goes for the slower one, drops it short, Kulasekara picked it up really well, waited for it to arrive before biffing it over midwicket boundary. And this is his first ODI fifty. Fighting knock
fuller, outside off stump and Kula lashes it wide of backward point and the ball crashes against the point boundary
slower one, on a length outside off, left alone
length delivery straightening outside off, steered to third man
And it's all over. Full delivery, dragged straight to mid-on. Fine win for NZ. The group is split wide open. Sri Lanka are virtually out of this tournament. Sorrow and joy collide.
